My Interpretation:
Why Gradient Boosting is achieved highest overall classification accuracy  and highest sensitivity
This model starts with a weak learner (small decision tree), each next tree focuses specifically on the songs the previous tree misclassified
So it incrementally corrects itself, classification errors
This is making boosting extremely good at capturing subtle patterns in lyrical features
Lyrics data naturally is non linear data, and it has many stylistic patterns that we can observe, and the data has
Gradient Boosting is excellent at modelling these fine grained differences
UDAT generates hundreds of linguistic and statistical descriptors., boosting prevents the overfitting through shrinkage and learning rate
It outperforms RF because it focuses on hard to classify songs
Random Forest is the BEST 2?
Lyrics are not linearly separable, with UDAT computation the feature set contains many correlated features and many irrelevant features
Random Forest performs strongly because it can handle  high variance datasets(datasets with hundreds of features)
It is slightly lower than Gradient Boosting, because all the trees are independent
This is saying that it is capturing features and understanding better classification
